name: bushman
content:
sometimes offensive a word, which is sometimes offensive, for a member of one of the first groups of people to live in southern Africa, especially in the Kalahari desert, who used to live as hunter-gatherers: The Kalahari Bushmen have lived on this land for millennia. See also
San
mainly Australian English a person who lives in the bush (= a wild area of land): Naturalist Wyn Jones is an expert bushman.
More examplesFewer examplesFor thousands of years, African Bushmen have eaten a cactus-like plant to suppress hunger.Tomkinson offers non-hunting safaris that focus on experiencing life among native Zulus and bushmen. an anthropologist studying the Bushmen of Africa Kalahari bushmen, many of whom are illiterate, have had no way to pass on their vast knowledge of wildlife to people outside their culture.
